professions.name: armorsmith
professions.description: Armorsmiths make armor from raw materials.

professions.name: blacksmith
professions.description: Blacksmiths turn raw metal into useful materials.

professions.name: farrier
professions.description: Farriers make horseshoes and perform veterinarian surgery.

professions.name: weaponsmith
professions.description: Weaponsmiths specialize in making weapons.

professions.name: cleric
professions.description: Clerics are divine messengers who carry out the will of the gods.

professions.name: paladin
professions.description: Paladins are holy warriors who wield divine magic in addition to their fighing skill.

professions.name: soldier
professions.description: Soldiers are formally trained fighters with allegiance to a fighting unit.

professions.name: warrior
professions.description: Warriors are fighters who have no formal training, but have gained experience in battle.

professions.name: apothecary
professions.description: Apothecaries make healing salves and ointments.

professions.name: bowyer
professions.description: Bowyers craft bows for use in hunting and combat.

professions.name: carpenter
professions.description: Carpenters produce furniture and other works from finished lumber.

professions.name: cartwright
professions.description: Cartwrights build carts, wagons, and other land vehicles.

professions.name: cobbler
professions.description: Cobblers make shoes from leather and other materials.

professions.name: mason
professions.description: Masons architect and build structures from finished stone.

professions.name: tailor
professions.description: Tailors take fabrics and make them into clothing.

professions.name: alchemist
professions.description: Alchemists take raw materials and use magic to turn them into new substances.

professions.name: necromancer
professions.description: Necromancers use magic to speak with and sometimes raise the dead.

professions.name: scrollmaker
professions.description: Scrollmakers enscribe sorcerous incantations onto paper for later use by skilled practitioners.

professions.name: sorcerer
professions.description: Sorcerers wield intuitive magic.

professions.name: warlock
professions.description: Warlocks wield magic borne of strange and terrible origins.

professions.name: wizard
professions.description: Wizards study magic as a science and wield it in complex and powerful ways.

professions.name: animal trainer
professions.description: Animal trainers tame animals and turn them into disciplined followers.

professions.name: baker
professions.description: Bakers bake bread and other oven-derived goods from grain and related ingredients.

professions.name: beekeeper
professions.description: Beekeepers produce refined honey products.

professions.name: brewer
professions.description: Brewers turn grain into ale, beer, and related beverages.

professions.name: distiller
professions.description: Distillers make hard alcoholic beverages.

professions.name: farmer
professions.description: Farmers till the earth and practice animal husbandry.

professions.name: glassmaker
professions.description: Glassmakers turn sand and other materials into glass.

professions.name: jeweller
professions.description: Jewellers cut raw gem ore into sparkling gemstones.

professions.name: logger
professions.description: Loggers cut down trees to make lumber.

professions.name: miller
professions.description: Millers take raw grain and turn it into flour.

professions.name: miner
professions.description: Miners extract raw ore from the earth.

professions.name: potter
professions.description: Potters turn raw clay into finished pots and other ceramics.

professions.name: spinner
professions.description: Spinners create thread and cloth from raw fibers.

professions.name: tanner
professions.description: Tanners turn raw animal skin into cured hides.

professions.name: vintner
professions.description: Vintners make wine.

professions.name: bard
professions.description: Bards are minstrels who travel and entertain.

professions.name: mayor
professions.description: Mayors coordinate a town or city.

professions.name: merchant
professions.description: Merchants buy, sell, and trade goods.

professions.name: noble
professions.description: Nobles act as military coordinators, protectors, and leaders.

professions.name: philosopher
professions.description: Philosophers reason about the nature of the universe and teach others.

professions.name: priest
professions.description: Priests interpret the will of the gods.

professions.name: shaman
professions.description: Shamans speak for the spirits.
